Articles.Content:
This may be "Not a Bug", but it feels a bit extreme if it is...

I am exploding decouplers (and fuel tanks) when staging a craft.

For instance, using a simple craft composed of a nose cone, 1.25m probe core, FL-T400 fuel tank, T-45 Swivel, decoupler, FL-T400 tank, and another Swivel, with the decoupler and upper stage T-45 activated by the same staging event, the decoupler and the empty fuel tank below it explode instantly, with this sort of message in the log:


[LOG 10:00:36.377] activating stage 0 - current stage: 1
[LOG 10:00:36.377] [probeStackSmall]: Activated
[LOG 10:00:36.378] [fuelTank]: Activated
[LOG 10:00:36.379] [liquidEngine2]: Activated
[LOG 10:00:36.385] [00:01:29]: Separation of stage 1 confirmed
[LOG 10:00:36.386] [stackDecoupler]: Activated
[LOG 10:00:36.386] [pointyNoseConeA]: Activated
[LOG 10:00:36.397] [00:01:29]: TR-18A Stack Decoupler was heated by engine exhaust from LV-T45 "Swivel" Liquid Fuel Engine.
[LOG 10:00:36.409] [00:01:29]: TR-18A Stack Decoupler exploded due to overheating.
[LOG 10:00:36.410] stackDecoupler Exploded!! - blast awesomeness: 0.5
[LOG 10:00:36.413] [stackDecoupler]: Deactivated
[LOG 10:00:36.419] 1 explosions created.
[LOG 10:00:36.427] [00:01:29]: FL-T800 Fuel Tank was heated by engine exhaust from LV-T45 "Swivel" Liquid Fuel Engine.
[LOG 10:00:36.525] [00:01:29]: FL-T800 Fuel Tank exploded due to overheating.
[LOG 10:00:36.526] fuelTank.long Exploded!! - blast awesomeness: 0.5
[LOG 10:00:36.528] [fuelTank.long]: Deactivated
[LOG 10:00:36.533] 1 explosions created.
[LOG 10:00:36.542] [00:01:29]: LV-T45 "Swivel" Liquid Fuel Engine was heated by engine exhaust from LV-T45 "Swivel" Liquid Fuel Engine.

I originally saw this in a modded install, but I reproduced the above with a completely unmodded 1.0.5 configuration, as well. Like I said up top, maybe this is by design, but it feel excessive to have lower stages exploding from exhaust heat.

Hi MOARdV, engine heat was reworked for 1.0.5

* Heating from engine exhaust rebalanced.

See also this thread.

But if you would like to add a feedback issue to the tracker you can let Squad know you find it too extreme.

Tracker issues can be voted on, so others who agree can give your feedback issue more weight
